item.title: Does Leon Kennedy Die in Resident Evil 9?
item.content:encoded:
Resident Evil Requiem spoilers are out in the wild, and while many are looking to avoid them, others are actively hunting them down to find out the fate of Leon Kennedy.

Resident Evil Requiem releases February 27, and Leon Kennedy is one of two playable characters in the game, alongside Grace Ashcroft. While Grace is a new face in the series, Leon is an established name in the franchise, and his fate is a significant talking point.

If you’re actively on the hunt to find out what happens to Leon Kennedy, the answer is below. If you don’t want anything spoiled, look away now!

Warning: This article contains major spoilers for Resident Evil Requiem. This is your last chance to leave!

Does Leon Kennedy Die in Resident Evil Requiem?

The fate of Leon Kennedy in Resident Evil Requiem depends on the ending you experience, as there are two different endings you can encounter.

Only one of these is the canon ending, however, which Capcom will use moving forward as the main timeline for the Resident Evil franchise. If you’re a fan of Leon Kennedy, the good news is that he’s not dead in canon, and will be around for future entries in the series.

  • More Insider Gaming: All Resident Evil Requiem Spoilers

It is possible to have Leon die in your save, however, as the ‘bad’ ending results in his death. The ending ultimately comes down to a big choice of what you choose to do with Elpis.

If you choose to release Elpis, the ‘good’, and canonically, ending is shown, whereas choosing to destroy Elpis ultimately leads to the death of Leon Kennedy.

What Happens to Leon Kennedy in Resident Evil Requiem?

As mentioned, the ultimate fate of Leon Kennedy depends on the action you choose to take with Elpis, but both endings have a significant impact.

In the ‘good ending’, Victor Gideon appears at the end of the game to kill Zeno, and Elpis is released. This cures Leon’s infection, resulting in him de-ageing and becoming younger. It’s not entirely clear where Capcom plans to go from here, but making him younger in canon opens the door for him to star again in the future.

  • More Insider Gaming: Does Resident Evil Requiem Have Early Access?

The difference in the bad ending is that Gideon does not appear to save Leon from Zeno, who subsequently explodes Leon’s head. He doesn’t survive either, however, as the platform they are both on collapses.

For more Resident Evil Requiem content, find out when the review embargo of the game is, and take a look at the complete list of achievements and trophies.

item.title: Poppy Playtime Chapter 5 Ending Explained
item.content:encoded:
The world of Poppy Playtime is packed with lore that slowly comes together across each chapter. There’s a core narrative to follow, but players willing to dig deeper will uncover layers of hidden details and disturbing revelations scattered throughout the game.

Many fans expected Chapter 5 to finally provide the answers, especially with speculation that it would serve as the series’ finale. Instead, it delivers one of the biggest cliff-hangers yet, raising even more questions about how Mob Entertainment plans to conclude the story.

If you’re trying to piece together what it all means, you’re in the right place—Insider Gaming has broken down the Poppy Playtime Chapter 5 ending and explored what it could signal for the future of the franchise.

It should go without saying, but just in case it was unclear, Major spoilers ahead!

Poppy Playtime Chapter 5 Ending Explained

The ending kicks off with Huggy Wuggy and Kissy Missy finally being reunited with one another—that is, until the Prototype barges in.

After evading him at Lily Lovebraids’ tea party, the Prototype is back with a vengeance, as they make swift work of Huggy Wuggy and Kissy Missy, practically killing them in the process—though their fates remain up in the air.

It’s every man for themselves at this point, and the protagonist swiftly boards the train in an effort to escape the hulking Prototype. However, the metallic, arachnid body manages to keep up, and after a back and forth across the carriages, the train explodes with the Prototype onboard.

  • More Insider Gaming: How To Get Pressure Hand In Poppy Playtime Chapter 5—Locker Code, Explained

You didn’t think it’d be that easy, did you? Before long, he rises out of the wreckage and gives the protagonist the same treatment that they gave the Wuggys—a sharp stab through the chest. As if that wasn’t bad enough, you’re dumped into a vat of Poppy Gel and left for dead.

Thankfully, Giblet is there to save the day, as you’re revived and shocked back to life. It’s revealed that the Prototype took off with Poppy, and you might think that Chapter 5 would end there, but there’s still one more big reveal left in store…

What Is The Backup In Poppy Playtime Chapter 5?

It’s not over yet, as you and Giblet finally arrive at the Data Storage, where the ‘Backup’ is supposed to be.

You’ve been searching for it all chapter, and now it’s right in front of you. An old computer lies there waiting to be turned on, and once you bypass the Override, it’s finally activated, only for a familiar face—or eye—to be revealed.

  • More Insider Gaming: How Much Does Poppy Playtime Chapter 5 Cost? Price, Explained

The Backup isn’t just some files or documents that might help you defeat the Prototype. No, it’s much worse than that, as it’s none other than Harley Sawyer—the man behind converting orphans into the monstrous toys you’re constantly evading. As the computer boots up, the same eye flickers, looks around, before dropping one final, haunting line to close out the chapter.

Well now, this is a rather interesting turn of events…

Will he be friend or foe? Does he know how to destroy the Prototype? And will he even be willing to help you? There are tons of questions left unanswered once the credits roll, and it’s going to be an excruciating wait before an inevitable Chapter 6 rolls around, but one thing is clear: Harley Sawyer is back, and you’re going to need his help.

What did you make of the Poppy Playtime Chapter 5 ending? Share your thoughts in the official Insider Gaming Discord Server.

For more Poppy Playtime content, check out what platforms it’s available on.

item.title: Resident Evil Requiem Release Date Countdown & Exact Start Times
item.content:encoded:
No one ever thought the day would come when we would return to the bombed-out, decrepit remains of Raccoon City. Resident Evil Requiem gives everyone one more round, and if you’re ready to load the chamber again, find out when the Resident Evil Requiem release date is and expected release times.

There’s always a special vibe when a new Resi game is on the way. Resident Evil Requiem isn’t just a new game; it brings back Leon Kennedy for his first new outing since Resident Evil 6 (not counting the remakes). Throw in Grace Ashcroft, a lot of combat, puzzles, and the odd zombie, and you know you’re in for a good time.

When Is Resident Evil Requiem Coming Out? Release Date, Explained

Resident Evil Requiem has set a date with destiny for February 27, 2026.

When Requiem was first announced, there were so many questions: How will Grace differ from Chris, Jill, Leon, and everyone that came before? Then, with RPD being sighted, we wondered if Leon was going to make one final bow.

  • More Insider Gaming: Resident Evil Requiem Trophy List

So much has been learned since Requiem first came to light. Once the February 27 release date was locked in, it immediately became a date for the diary. Whether you’re taking a mysterious sick day or you’ve booked it off, everyone will be there on launch day for the next chapter in the mainline timeline.

Resident Evil 9 Release Times

According to the PlayStation Store, Resident Evil Requiem launches at 9 PM PT.

Companies generally only post release time sheets on social media a day or two before launch. Right now, Capcom has done no such thing for Requiem. On the plus side, the PlayStation Store is known for posting an early look at a game’s launch time.

However, it must be said that this isn’t 100% accurate. It could change, and if it does, check back in as the guide is updated with new information to reflect this.

  • More Insider Gaming: How Long To Beat Resident Evil Requiem? Game Length & Total Hours

For now, check out all the current release times below in this handy table.

Which time zone do you fall in? Is Resident Evil Requiem going to be a nice after-work treat? Or do you need to see what’s happening in Raccoon City around midnight? Let the team know through the Insider Gaming Discord Server, which, as ever, is free to join.

For more on Resi 9, check out if Resident Evil Requiem has early access.

item.title: Pokémon TCG Pocket Paldean Wonders Booster Set Arrives Next Week
item.content:encoded:
Pokémon TCG Pocket has revealed a new themed booster set centered around Gen 9, called Paldean Wonders.

Earlier today, Pokémon TCG Pocket developers teased the upcoming set with a video featuring people in Sprigatito, Fuecoco, and Quaxly costumes. Players speculated that it might be a tease for a new Gen 9 set, and they were right. Check out more details on the new announcement below:

Pokémon TCG Pocket Paldean Wonders Set Arrives Next Week

A new post on the official Pokémon TCG Pocket X account (formerly Twitter) confirms the arrival of Paldean Wonders, a themed booster set that features Sprigatito, Fuecoco, and Quaxly. The new booster pack will be available in the game from February 25 at 5 PM PST.

The announcement comes with a new trailer, which first features the Paldean starter cards and then goes on to show cards for Pawmi, Smoliv, Fidough, Wooper, Maushold, Klawf, Ceruledge, Tinkatink, Meowscarada EX, Gholdengo EX, Nemona (Supporter), Arven (Supporter), and Mesagoza (Stadium).

In other news, the developers of Pokémon TCG Pocket have informed Insider Gaming that there are currently no plans to turn it into a competitive game; it will continue to function as a side event at tournaments. Additionally, here are six things Insider Gaming learned from attending Pokémon EUIC 2026 in London.

What are your thoughts on the Pokémon TCG Pocket Paldean Wonders Booster Set? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Wraith Ops Demo going live as dev promises ‘no battle pass, no fomo, no gacha’. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
